project_descr: Strengthening Public Finance Capacities in the Western Balkans and Commonwealth of Independent States

outputs.output_descr:
The objective of the programme is to enhance sound and effective public financial management by raising awareness, developing analytical capacities and sharing good practice with regard to reforms implemented in Slovakia and elsewhere. 
Programme expected results:
1. Beneficiary countries identified for programme assistance
2. Cooperation mechanisms with beneficiary countries established and operational
3. Assistance harmonized with donors and duplicaiton of activities prevented
4. Institutional arrangements designed to improve public financial management (PFM) functions
5. Systems and procedures adjusted to improve PFM functions
6. Staff capacities strengthened to understand PFM concepts and skills developed to conduct PFM tasks
7. Non-government stakeholders (NGOs, media, students, etc) understanding of public finance concepts improved.
8. Lessons learned from PFM reforms in Slovakia disseminated
9. Programme visible among key stakeholder groups in Slovakia and in the region (finance ministries, central and local governments, NGOs, media, donors, embassies, etc.).

Programme currently supports Moldova and Montenegro. Areas of cooperation were selected and specific activities were designed jointly with beneficiary finance ministries.  
Projects implemented in beneficiary countries:
Moldova - capacity building for performance based budgeting (primary beneficiary: Ministry of Finance of Moldova, secondary beneficiary: central and local public administrations in Moldova)
Montenegro - 1) capacity building for macro-economic and fiscal forecasting; 2) Adoption of ESA 95 methodology; 3) improving accounting and reporting system in Montenegro; 4) strengthening capacities for public debt management in Montenegro.  (primary beneficiary: Ministry of Finance of Montenegro).
